properties.name: Abode Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Greendig 1541 Ocean Ave. Santa Monica, CA 90401Riding the wave of the global eco-current, Abode restaurant in Santa Monica is a new hot spot that blends environmentally friendly building materials with urban chic design--outside, a terra cotta tiled courtyard where al fresco dining takes place and inside, sustainable black walnut dining tables. Amidst what might be called the "green period," the folks at Abode have created a work of art in more ways than one. The delicately and creatively prepared dishes are lorded over by Executive Chef Dominique Crenn, a French native whose subtle mélanges have graced eateries from San Francisco to Jakarta. Her ingredients--organic, artisanal and sustainable--make up the culinary wing of Abode\'s eco-philosophy. properties.name: Adam Joseph Lewis Center for Environmental Studies
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  The Lewis Center is fundamentally a place of wonder and beauty that seeks to celebrate and to regenerate human and natural environments, aspiring to be as bountiful and effective as a tree. By reconsidering design assumptions for the future, the building seeks to reverse the tragic (if unintended) consequences of the first Industrial Revolution. The Center operates on three fundamental principles of nature. waste equals food, use current solar income, and respect diversity. An integrated approach to natural energy flows will allow the Center to evolve into a net-energy exporter. Just as the building\'s materials promote long-term human and ecological health, the vibrant atrium at the building\'s core enriches the social character of the place, functioning as the town hall for Oberlin\'s southern campus.

properties.description: Posted by Biodeva2465 Fourth street Berkeley, CA2465 4th Street @ Dwight Way * Berkeley, CA 94710 | 510.665.5509 HOURS: Mondays: Closed | Sundays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays, & Thursdays: 4:00pm - 8:00pm Fridays: by appointment | Saturdays: 10:00am - 5:00pm Biodiesel: We sell high quality commercial biodiesel that meets ASTM standards. We prefer to sell biodiesel that is made from recycled vegetable oil. We currently sell B99. The price includes sales tax, state excise tax, and federal excise tax. You can pump directly into your car from our fuel station-style pump that\'s California Weights and Measures certified. We also offer fuel in 5 gallon containers called carboys that give you the freedom of fueling whenever and wherever you like. Many of our customers fill up their tanks and then stock up with 10-20 gallons in carboys, so they only come to the Oasis every month or two and minimize their driving to get fuel. The carboys cost for the container plus the cost of the 5 gallons of fuel. BioFuel Oasis was founded in 2003 to provide greater access to biodiesel, a renewable fuel that reduces harmful tailpipe emissions. We are a women/worker-owned & operated cooperative that values sustainability, local production, and community.

properties.name: COLORS
properties.description: Posted by Farmaid417 Lafayette St, New York, NYLocated on a busy street in the NOHO (North of Houston) area of Manhattan, COLORS serves global cuisine fused with classic American style fare and is dedicated in equal parts to excellence in food quality, service and employee welfare. The dining room is a chic and sophisticated space designed in a classic art deco style featuring original light fixtures from the 1939 World’s Fair and reproductions of 30’s era design elements. There is a main dining room that seats 100 guests and a private dining room that seats 25. COLORS can accommodate up to 225 people for cocktail parties. A Peters map spans the length of the south wall, unpretentiously reminding diners of the kind of global culinary experience they are about to indulge in. The menu is inspired by the staff’s own family recipes which are innovatively reworked to create a unique fine dining experience in New York City. In addition, the COLORS menu changes seasonally, which allows guests to look forward to uncharted culinary journeys every season. COLORS is the largest cooperative restaurant in the United States, owned by more than 50 worker-owners hailing from approximately 20 countries. Every member of the COLORS staff is a co-owner: chefs, bus boys, bartenders, waiters and hostesses. Many were formerly employed at Windows on the World in the World Trade Center. Post 9/11, COLORS has provided jobs where none were available, but more importantly, continues to provide all worker-owners with opportunities for advancement and invaluable experience in the decision-making that goes into running a restaurant. Members of the staff contribute recipes from their many and varied countries of origin. Every member of the staff has a stake in the success of the enterprise meaning that each is committed to ensuring that every guest has a fine dining experience.

properties.name: Delfina Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  3621 18th Street, San Francisco, CA, 94110Delfina Restaurant 415-552-4055 Delfina is a bustling neighborhood trattoria in San Francisco\'s Mission District, owned by Anne and Craig Stoll. The food is Italian in spirit- simple, seasonal cooking which belies its depth of flavor. Modeled after small mom and pop restaurants found throughout Italy, the menu changes daily, driven by the offerings of local producers. The wine list, like the food, focuses exclusively on Italy and California. The setting and service both are imbued with the vibe of the restaurant\'s Mission neighborhood. Friendly, tattooed and incredibly knowledgeable, the servers have been recognized as "do(ing) their job better than many tuxedoed traditionalist." Delfina was awarded "Best Service" in San Francisco\'s 2003 reader\'s poll. As designed by Douglas Burnham of Envelope Architecture, the rich pallet of wrapping Jarrah hardwoods and zinc tables creates a warm, tactile space. Delfina is named after Ristorante Da Delfina in Artimino (Tuscany) where Craig worked in the winter of \'91.

properties.name: Dennis K. Burke, Incorporated
properties.description: Posted by SystemBioDiesel Refueling Station, Public - credit card after hours. 410 Beacham Street, Chelsea MA 02150. 800-289-2875. For over 40 years, Dennis K. Burke, Inc. has been reliably delivering premium diesel fuel, motor oil and gasoline to fleets and industry throughout the Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Rhode Island area. While Detroit offers several variations of new Alternative Fuel Vehicles (AFV) that average over 50 miles to the gallon, independent fuel marketers are introducing "Biodiesel," a healthier, renewable energy solution that seems to be meeting just about everyone\'s approval. The Burke Gas Station on Beacham Street in Chelsea is the first station in the state of Massachusetts to offer biodiesel products Biodiesel B20 at the pump and Biodiesel B100 in drums and pails. Biodiesel is a clean, diesel fuel substitute made from soybeans, canola, and recycled cooking oil from restaurants. It can be burned safely in any standard, unmodified diesel engine, either in pure form (B100) or in a 20% blend (B20) with 80% petroleum diesel. Most truck manufacturers recommend using B20 in their engines. Pure biodiesel is completely biodegradable, and poses minimal concerns to soil and water contamination. Biodiesel is also non-toxic to plants, animals and humans. On the performance side, biodiesel\'s higher cetane rating results in excellent engine performance and fuel economy. Biodiesel has outstanding lubricity characteristics. Blend ratios as low as 1% can provide up to 30% more lubricity over conventional diesel fuel. And a higher flash point means it\'s safer to handle. As one of New England\'s largest suppliers of diesel fuel, gasoline and motor oil products, Dennis K. Burke is proud to be first in bringing biodiesel to Massachusetts.

properties.name: Farm 255 restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   255 W. Washington Street, Athens, GA 30601From the Farm 255 website: "Farm 255 is a restaurant that seeks to reconnect food to its roots & people to their food. We serve local, seasonal, & sustainable food for supper nightly. In addition to the Farm we manage Full Moon Farms, a 7-acre organic/biodynamic farm in Athens. Unlike the owners of any other restaurant we know of, we are the folks sowing turnip seeds in the morning and cooking turnip greens in the evening. We supplement our harvests with those of other local family farmers and ranchers that avoid harmful chemicals and practice sustainable agriculture. Our menu, based on seasonal shifts in the field, changes as often as the weather. Our meat comes from pasture-raised animals & is hormone & antibiotic free. We purchase whole animals & use all the various cuts of meat throughout our menu. "We are as committed to good community as we are to our cuisine. We have an open kitchen so that dinner is a dialogue, where the farmer-chefs and diner-neighbors can have a meaningful exchange; we offer live music every night in honor of its legacy in this town; and we designed our restaurant with an eye toward the history of the 1930’s building that houses it. For us here at the Farm, eating is a celebration of food’s origins, the paths it travels on the way to our tables, and the lessons learned through the journey." I added them here because they are participating in an Outstanding in the Field farm dinner on September 10, 2006, in Athens, Georgia.

properties.name: Fourth Dimension Fuels
properties.description: Posted by SystemBioDiesel Refueling Station, Public - call ahead. 1395 W American Avenue, Oracle AZ 85623. 520-609-1162 Fourth Dimension Fuels (FDF) is a Southern-Arizona woman-owned microbusiness founded in May 2003 with the goal of bringing biodiesel to the residents and travelers of the tri-community area of Oracle, San Manuel, and Mammoth. The county\'s first, FDF\'s biodiesel pump was opened in May of 2004, with an official grand opening celebration that took place in August 2004, with help from Colleen Crowninshield (Tucson Regional Clean Cities Coalition Coordinator) and special guest Charris Ford (founder of Grassolean Solutions of Telluride, Colorado). Today, in addition to supplying biodiesel, Fourth Dimension Fuels has expanded to: install Greasecar conversion kits, which allow owners of diesel vehicles to power their engines with waste vegetable oil; educate students and community members about biofuels; host the weekly, year-round Oracle Farmer\' Market; and provide access to a wide array of natural and organic foods and household products via the Tucson Cooperative Warehouse. In 2005, Fourth Dimension Fuels plans to host classes in such subjects as Ayurvedic medicine; the benefits of honey and bee pollen; natural building materials; and other subjects taught primarily by community members. Check our calendar for upcoming events.

properties.name: Hillsdale Library
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  1525 S.W. Sunset Boulevard, Portland, OR 97239This is library location is a green building. Here is what their website say: Hillsdale Library was awarded Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED™) Gold certification in 2004. LEED™ is a national rating system and accreditation tool used to develop high performance, sustainable buildings. Buildings are awarded points and achieve a certain level of certification based on project procedures and design elements that are indicators of a "green building." The library, opened in March 2004, was the first Multnomah County building to receive LEED™ certification, a goal established by Multnomah County officials when they approved the construction of the building. The City of Portland has adopted LEED™ as the basis of design for all of its new construction. As a green building, Hillsdale Library offers many benefits, including: environmental protection (reduced air and water pollution, reduction in solid waste creation, and minimized depletion of natural resources); economic advantages (reduced operating costs and optimized economic performance over the life of the building); and health and safety benefits (better indoor air quality, decreased harmful pollutants indoors and out, and increased personal satisfaction). To achieve LEED™ certification, Hillsdale Library incorporates many environmental design elements that significantly reduce or eliminate the building\'s negative impact on the environment, while providing an inviting, friendly and comfortable place for library users of all ages.

properties.name: Hoffman's
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   1102 Pacific Avenue, Santa Cruz, CA, 95060Hoffman\'s 831-420-0135 June and Ed Hoffman, longtime Santa Cruz residents, returned to Santa Cruz in 2000 to set up an exciting new bakery café with a full service dining room serving breakfast, lunch and dinner, breads, tortes and pastries, many of which are French inspired. Both June and Ed are UCSC graduates, as is their son Adam, the dining room manager. Ed started his baking career over 25 years ago in downtown Santa Cruz at the Old Theatre Cafe, where he was an apprentice baker under the tutelage of Lorenz Rothbucher. He also worked with Ron Schmidt, Al Negri, and Jean Wopplehorst, all former owners of bakeries in downtown Santa Cruz. It was a “natural” for Ed to think of moving to downtown Santa Cruz when he sold his shop in Kirkland, Washington, where the Hoffmans enjoyed 16 years of great success, providing award-winning cakes and pastries and exceptional wedding cakes. Visit our wedding cake gallery: http://www.hoffmansbakery.com/gallery.htm

properties.name: Jack's La Jolla
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  7863 Girard Ave La Jolla, CA 92037Jack\'s La Jolla has changed the culinary face of San Diego. With its three distinctive restaurants ranging from casual to fine dining and its four unique bars, the three level complex, located in the Village of La Jolla, overlooks a center courtyard featuring a fire pit and fountain. The Dining Room at Jack\'s, recently voted one of San Diego\'s top seven restaurants by the Gayot Guide, is the showcase of executive chef Tony DiSalvo. Formerly chef de cuisine at New York\'s Jean Georges, one of the top twenty restaurants in the world and winner of three stars in the Michelin Guide, DiSalvo along with chef de cuisine Marco Ferraro have created a menu of innovative contemporary American cuisine. The restaurant\'s sophisticated ambiance, stellar service and thoughtful wine list, make it a top San Diego dining destination. Hours of Operation: Nightly 5:30pm - 10:00pm Jack’s Grille, Located on the first level, the Grille takes advantage of the open air atrium. The menu is casual featuring pizzas, pastas, salads and sandwiches all presented with the thoughtful, artistic flair of executive chef Tony DiSalvo and his crew. Hours of Operation: Daily 11:30am - 2:00am The Wine Bar features a piano bar, an extensive wine list, and a large number of rotating wines by the glass are available daily. Hours of Operation: Daily 11:30am - 2:00am The Wall Street Bar is located between the Dining Room at Jack\'s and offers a quiet spot for a drink before dinner or just a place to relax. A variety of late night dance music makes it a perfect place of San Diego\'s sophisticated young professionals. Hours of Operation: Nightly 5:30pm to 2:00am Ocean View Room and Bar features views of La Jolla Cove and offer diners a sushi bar and grilled seafood and steaks. Open for lunch and dinner, the third floor is all San Diego: fresh seafood, outside dining and ocean views. The Beach Bar, which fronts on Girard, epitomizes fun. Guests can enjoy retro cocktails, seasonal drinks and the Ocean View Room menu. With steel drums playing in the background, the Beach Bar is La Jolla’s tiny spot in paradise. Hours of Operation: Daily 11:30am - 5pm | Thursday - Saturday open until 2:00am Jack’s Sidewalk Café welcomes guests throughout the day with freshly brewed coffees and teas, Italian sodas and smoothies. Pizza, Pasta, Panini, and salads plus a full range of pastries and cookies are available daily. Hours of Operation: Sunday - Tuesday 8:00am - 8:00pm | Wednesday, Thursday 8:00am -10:00pm | Friday, Saturday 8:00am - 11:00pm

properties.name: Jacob's Farm / Del Cabo
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler http://local.google.com/local?f=q&sll=37.006939,-122.043686&sspn=0.250586,0.414047&hl=en&q=farm,95060&latlng=36982946,-122043612,2653263545090252124Located on the California coast, forty-fives miles south of San Francisco, JACOBS FARM grows a complete line of culinary herbs (including hard to find exotic herbs), English peas, sugar snap peas, arugula, red beets, edible flowers, fava beans, and olallieberries. Founded in 1980 as an ORGANIC specialty farm, Jacobs Farm has grown to 200 cultivated acres. In 1985 we founded Del Cabo, a project in Baja California established to assist small growers by teaching organic growing practices, management and organizational skills and connecting them to markets in the USA, Canada, Europe, and Asia. Our Del Cabo line includes a year round supply of basil and specialty cherry tomatoes. Our commitment to organic farming is rooted in our belief that the use of chemical fertilizers and toxic pest control materials are detrimental to our health and the health of our planet. Healthy soil is the cornerstone of organic farming while chemical inputs destroy organisms needed to build a healthy soil. A healthy soil is critical to producing healthy plants and a healthy environment.

properties.name: Just Food
properties.description: Posted by Farmaid 208 E. 51st Street, NY 10022Just Food was founded in 1995 in response to three major challenges: the loss of family farms, the rise of hunger, malnutrition, and diet-related disease, and the lack of economic opportunity in underserved neighborhoods. Because we believe a joint solution to these challenges is the best solution, our programs address all three of these issues simultaneously by building partnerships with, and providing resources and training to community groups, sustainable farmers and urban gardeners. The support we offer and the trainings we provide connect regional farmers with profitable markets and strengthen some of New York City’s most underserved neighborhoods by creating new economic opportunities, improving community health, and preserving urban green spaces. For more information please visit us at www.justfood.org

properties.name: Kokkari Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   200 Jackson Street, San Francisco, CA, 94111Kokkari Restaurant 415-981-0983 Kokkari (pronounced Ko-kar-ee) is a small fishing village located on the island of Samos in the Aegean Sea, whose name is derived from the small onions that were once produced in nearby fields. Its fertile soil and Mediterranean climate translated into an abundance of fresh produce as well as treasured seafood and game. Legend tells that Kokkari is the site where Orion, a mighty hunter and a young man of gigantic stature and great beauty, fell in love with the daughter of the King of Chios. For the love of her, Orion foraged the island for wild game and seafood to prepare elaborate banquets in celebration of their love. Today we hope you will enjoy your own celebration as you dine at Kokkari Estiatorio on food "fit for the Gods" prepared with an Aegean palate and the style of innovative California fare.

properties.name: Kuumbwa Jazz Center
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 320 Cedar St., Santa Cruz CA 95060 World-class jazz center presenting quality music and dinner in an intimate setting. 320-2 Cedar St • Santa Cruz, CA, 95060 Contact: Julie Rix, production/facility manager Phone: 831.427.2227 The blending of the culinary arts and the art of jazz seems to be the perfect recipe for enjoying a creative evening. The renowned Kuumbwa Jazz Center is a nonprofit organization that has been presenting world-class jazz since 1975. Each Monday night we present internationally known jazz artists and serve dinner prepared by our chef Cheryl Simons. Cheryl cooks with the freshest local ingredients, sometimes from her own organic garden. Her meals are always a delicious compliment to the shows. Thursday nights are the “Cookin’ at the Kuumbwa” series where we feature great music from local and regional musicians along with specially prepared dinners...and they are one of the best deals in town! Cookin’ at the Kuumbwa features: “Guest Chefs” from some of the finest local restaurants; “Closet Chefs” whose talents are established elsewhere, but we have faith you’re going to like what they serve, along with Café Kuumbwa resident chef Cheryl Simons. We also offer select local wines and beers.

LA BRUSCHETTA strives to provide the highest quality using organic products whenever possible, fresh ingredients, and homemade dishes. LA BRUSCHETTA offers an extensive selection of imported and domestic wines to savor with your meal, as well as rich cappuccino coffees to accompany your homemade tiramisu or gelati. Pleasant summer dining on its flower strewn garden patio under an ancient oak with redwoods towering in the background and elegant year-round indoor dining are offered at LA BRUSCHETTA. The talented Rubino Familia\'s beautiful stained glass pieces and paintings adorn the restaurant, along with typical Sicilian crafts. Chef Luca Rubino & Familia invite you to visit their popular Felton restaurant, where Santa Cruz County\'s most delicious Sicilian cuisine is artfully prepared for your delight with local produce from the Santa Cruz mountains.

properties.name: NOx and Energy Assessment Tool (NxEAT)
properties.description: Posted by P2ric1000 Independence Ave., SW Washington, DC The NOx and Energy Assessment Tool (NxEAT) helps plants in the petroleum refining and chemical industries to assess and analyze NOx emissions and application of energy efficiency improvements. Use the tool to inventory emissions from equipment that generates NOx, and then compare how various technology applications and efficiency measure affect overall costs and reduction of NOx. Perform “what-if” analyses to optimize and select the most cost-effective methods for reducing NOx from systems such as fired heaters, boilers, gas turbines, and reciprocating engines.

properties.name: Rubber Sidewalks in Seattle
properties.description: Posted by Jason Seattle, WALiz Ellis, an arborist with the city\'s transportation department, championed bringing rubber sidewalks to Seattle after she read they were being tested in Santa Monica, Calif., and other cities. She was intrigued not by the novelty of it. Nor did she want to give Seattleites a little extra bounce in their step as the winter gloom sets in. She pointed to a mound in the rubber sidewalk, raised by the roots growing from one of the red maple trees on the shady, lush street of small houses on Eighth Avenue South, between South Rose and South Thistle streets. Across the street, where the sidewalk is concrete, the growing roots of another tree had already cracked it. "That (sidewalk) was just put in about a year ago," Ellis said. The rubberized sidewalks are more elastic, so instead of cracking, they stretch, and have to be replaced less often and are cheaper to fix, Ellis said.

properties.name: Rubber Sidewalks, Santa Monica
properties.description: Posted by Hive Santa Monica, CAThe popularity of Southern California\'s most destructive curbside shade tree is starting to bounce back--thanks to rubber sidewalks. Leafy ficus trees have helped cool neighborhood roadsides for decades. As they have grown, though, their stubborn roots have created safety hazards by pushing concrete sidewalk slabs out of the ground. That has prompted repair crews throughout the region to chop down rows of the dense, green-canopied trees. Replacement trees have generally been slower-growing and scrawnier-looking. But street maintenance workers in Southern California will soon be stretching the life expectancy of the ficus by using flexible sidewalks made from recycled automobile tires.

The Phan family opened the original Slanted Door in 1995 with a vision to blend Vietnamese cooking technique with local ingredients. The new restaurant takes this vision even further in its new environment, designed by Olle Lundberg, overlooking the San Francisco Bay. The food, relaxed atmosphere, riesling-driven wine list, full bar with premium brands and fresh squeezed juices, and hard-to-find Chinese teas all speak to the restaurant\'s originality and commitment to quality. Our to-go store called "Out the Door" is now open in the main hall of the Ferry Building, around the corner from the restaurant. Out the Door offers prepared dishes as well as easy-to-use cooking kits that give you the opportunity to make our dishes at home.

properties.name: UCSC Farm & Garden
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler95064The Center for Agroecology & Sustainable Food Systems is a research, education, and public service program at the University of California, Santa Cruz, dedicated to increasing ecological sustainability and social justice in the food and agriculture system. On the UCSC campus, the Center operates the 2-acre Alan Chadwick Garden and the 25-acre Farm. Both sites are managed using organic production methods and serve as research, teaching, and training facilities for students, staff, and faculty.

properties.name: UCSC Farm and Garden Project
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler   1156 High St., santa cruz, california 95064The UCSC Farm & Garden are operated by staff and students of the Center for Agroecology & Sustainable Food Systems at UC Santa Cruz. The Farm & Garden serve as training sites for students in the six-month Apprenticeship in Ecological Horticulture, who raise a wide variety of vegetable, fruit, and flower crops as part of their hands-on training. Fresh organic produce is sold twice a week through a 90-member CSA and the market cart, located at the base of campus.

properties.name: Zuni Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler  1658 Market St, San Francisco, CAZuni Cafe 415-552-2522 This James Beard Award winning restaurant with a clientele as diverse as San Francisco opened in 1979. A vibrant Parisian-style standing-only copper bar greets you as you enter on Rose Alley. Zuniâ€™s menu changes daily with dishes inspired by traditional Italian and French recipes. Nearly all of the produce, meat, and fish served at Zuni is farmed and harvested in a sustainable manner. Even without a reservation, bar tables are available on a first come, first served basis and the full menu is available. The bar also serves traditional cocktails made with top-shelf ingredients; refreshments at its best in an environment of effortless hospitality. Whether you dine early or prefer to dine after theater, Zuni is a welcoming haven.

properties.name: cesar
properties.description: Posted by Tanabutler 1515 Shattuck Avenue, BERKELEY, CA, 94709-1516César presents a unique combination of Spanish food, a French name, American restaurateurs, and a global, award-winning selection of wines and spirits. Founded in 1998 by three Chez Panisse alumni – Richard Mazzera, Dennis Lapuyade, and Stephen Singer – César is essentially a Mediterranean-style bar/restaurant that serves a delicious and diverse selection of Spanish tapas, or small plates. Our original location on Shattuck Avenue sits in the heart of what has affectionately become known as the “Gourmet Ghetto” in North Berkeley, right next door to Chez Panisse, the restaurant generally recognized as the genesis of what has come to be known as California cuisine.

properties.name: honest weight food co-op
properties.description: Posted by Farmaid 484 central ave. albany, nyHonest Weight Food Co-op, founded in 1976, is open to the public seven days a week. A member-owned and -operated organization, Honest Weight Food Co-op is committed to providing the community with affordable, high quality natural foods and products for healthy and ecologically sustainable living. The store offers a full line of brand-name grocery products, over 500 domestic and imported cheeses from rBGH-free dairies, an extensive selection of bulk foods, and the area’s widest selection of locally produced food products. Honest Weight Food Co-op is centrally located at 484 Central Avenue, between Partridge and Manning, in Albany, NY.
